titleStmt.title: Awake Sampson, the Philistines are upon thee! or, A caution to England to take heed to her locks, least they being cut off by intrigues, she be made to grind at the mill of France ... by a lover of the true interest of his country.
titleStmt.author: Lover of the true interest of his country.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by S. Bridge ..., and sold by E. Whitelock ...,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Columbia University Library.
